conclusion: Determine if the particle has returned to its starting point at the 3-second mark by analyzing the velocity-time graph.
The image shows a velocity-time graph with segments: horizontal from 0 to 1 second at 2 m/s, diagonal from 1 to 2 seconds decreasing, and horizontal from 2 to 3 seconds at 0 m/s.
Graph shows three segments: 0-1s constant velocity at 2 m/s, 1-2s velocity decreases linearly, 2-3s velocity is 0 m/s.
Integrate velocity over time from 0 to 1 second: 2 m.
Integrate velocity over time from 1 to 2 seconds: integral is 0.
Integrate velocity over time from 2 to 3 seconds: 0.
Since displacement is not zero, the particle has not returned to its starting point at the 3-second mark.
